leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 天文-时间域与瞬变检测生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 去噪→检测→分类→告警→调度

queries: [WEB] light curve classification deep learning github

tools.name: Multi-SConES
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-task feature selection for selecting connected explanatory SNPs in GWAS
tools.detailed_description: An R package implementing Multi-SConES, a method for multi-task feature selection coupled with multiple network regularizers, primarily used in bioinformatics for Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS) to identify significant SNPs.

tools.name: RESSPECT
tools.one_line_profile: Recommendation system for telescope resource allocation in supernova cosmology
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed by the Cosmostatistics Initiative (COIN) and LSST DESC to optimize photometric supernova cosmology analysis through an active learning-based recommendation system for telescope resource allocation.

tools.name: SCONE
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic Calculator Of Neutron transport Equation
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based stochastic calculator for solving the neutron transport equation, used in nuclear physics and engineering for simulating neutron behavior.

tools.name: HOPS
tools.one_line_profile: Software for single-object photometry and exoplanet light-curve modelling
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly software package designed for analyzing astronomical data, specifically for single-object photometry and modelling the light curves of exoplanets.

tools.name: MUTIS
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis of correlations of light curves and their statistical significance
tools.detailed_description: A Python package from IAA-CSIC for analyzing correlations in astronomical light curves and determining their statistical significance, useful for multi-wavelength studies.

tools.name: pgmuvi
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian processes for inference on multi-wavelength light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Gaussian processes for statistical inference on multi-wavelength astronomical light curves, enabling analysis of time-domain data across different spectral bands.

tools.name: pyzdcf
tools.one_line_profile: Estimation of cross-correlation function of astronomical time-series using ZDCF
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for estimating the cross-correlation function of sparse, unevenly sampled astronomical time-series data based on the Z-Transformed Discrete Correlation Function (ZDCF) method.

tools.name: elasticc
tools.one_line_profile: Infrastructure and metrics for the ELAsTiCC astronomical classification challenge
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing settings, configuration, and metric implementations for the Extended LSST Astronomical Time Series Classification Challenge (ELAsTiCC), used for evaluating transient classifiers.

tools.name: parsnip
tools.one_line_profile: Deep generative modeling of astronomical transient light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for deep generative modeling of astronomical transient light curves. It learns a low-dimensional representation of transients that can be used for classification, augmentation, and other analysis tasks.

tools.name: plasticc-kit
tools.one_line_profile: Starter Kit for the Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit providing data loaders, metrics, and example notebooks for the Photometric LSST Astronomical Time-series Classification Challenge (PLAsTiCC), facilitating the development of classification models for astronomical transients.

tools.name: snmachine
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning code for photometric supernova classification
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by LSST DESC for photometric supernova classification using various machine learning techniques, designed to process light curves and extract features for classification.

tools.name: allesfitter
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible inference framework for photometric and radial velocity data
tools.detailed_description: allesfitter is a python package for fitting photometric and radial velocity data. It is a wrapper around ellc, dynesty, emcee and celerite, allowing for a unified interface to model exoplanet transits, eclipsing binaries, and other photometric variability.

tools.name: Spacetimeformer
tools.one_line_profile: Long-Range Transformers for Dynamic Spatiotemporal Forecasting
tools.detailed_description: A multivariate time series forecasting framework using efficient Transformers, specifically designed to learn long-range dependencies in spatiotemporal data. While general-purpose, it is highly relevant for scientific modeling tasks involving space and time dynamics.

tools.name: VegasAfterglow
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance C++ framework for GRB afterglow modeling
tools.detailed_description: A C++ framework with Python bindings for modeling Gamma-Ray Burst (GRB) afterglows. It features fast multi-wavelength light curve generation, MCMC parameter inference, and advanced physics models including shock dynamics and structured jets.

tools.name: SCoPe-ML
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning classification pipeline for ZTF sources
tools.detailed_description: The SCoPe (ZTF Source Classification Project) repository contains the machine learning pipeline used for classifying astronomical sources detected by the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF).

tools.name: eleanor
tools.one_line_profile: Light curve extraction tool for TESS Full Frame Images
tools.detailed_description: eleanor is an open-source python package to extract target pixel files and light curves from the TESS Full Frame Images (FFIs). It allows users to obtain light curves for objects that were not originally targeted by the TESS mission.

tools.name: ATAT
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical Transformer for Time Series and Tabular Data
tools.detailed_description: ATAT is a Transformer-based model designed for processing astronomical time series and tabular data, developed as part of the ALeRCE broker ecosystem for classification and analysis tasks.

tools.name: ALeRCE Client
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for accessing the ALeRCE astronomical broker
tools.detailed_description: The official Python client for interacting with the ALeRCE (Automatic Learning for the Rapid Classification of Events) broker APIs, enabling astronomers to query and retrieve light curves, alerts, and classification data.

tools.name: LC Classifier
tools.one_line_profile: Light Curve Classifier for the ALeRCE Broker
tools.detailed_description: The Light Curve Classifier used by the ALeRCE broker system to classify astronomical alerts based on their photometric time-series data. It includes feature extraction and machine learning classification models.

tools.name: ALeRCE Pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Data processing pipeline for the ALeRCE broker
tools.detailed_description: The monorepo for the ALeRCE pipeline, containing the workflow and steps for processing astronomical alerts, from ingestion to classification and distribution.

tools.name: mind_the_gaps
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian Process analysis tool for irregularly-sampled astronomical time series
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing Gaussian Process time series analysis, specifically focused on period detection in irregularly-sampled and stochastically-varying astronomical light curves.

tools.name: gatspy
tools.one_line_profile: General tools for astronomical time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A library for astronomical time series analysis in Python, providing tools for periodogram analysis (Lomb-Scargle, Supersmoother) and Gaussian Process modeling of light curves.

tools.name: Fink Broker
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable broker for astronomical transient alerts based on Apache Spark
tools.detailed_description: A community-driven astronomy broker designed to process, filter, and classify high-volume transient alerts (e.g., from LSST/ZTF) in real-time using Apache Spark.

tools.name: Fink Client
tools.one_line_profile: Client library for retrieving and handling Fink broker alerts
tools.detailed_description: A light-weight Python client designed to manipulate and retrieve astronomical alerts from the Fink broker system.

tools.name: Fink Science
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific modules and classification algorithms for Fink broker
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scientific modules (machine learning classifiers, filters) used within the Fink broker pipeline to add value to astronomical alerts, such as supernova classification and microlensing detection.

tools.name: Fink Science Portal
tools.one_line_profile: Web portal for visualizing and exploring Fink astronomical alerts
tools.detailed_description: The web interface for the Fink broker, allowing astronomers to search, visualize, and analyze transient alert data and light curves.

tools.name: keplersplinev2
tools.one_line_profile: Robust B-spline fitting tool for astronomical light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python code for robustly fitting a basis spline to data, particularly useful for detrending and analyzing astronomical light curves (e.g., Kepler/K2 data).

tools.name: deepSIP
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for Supernova Ia parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework for estimating parameters of Type Ia Supernovae from optical spectra and light curves.

tools.name: Avocado (Genomics)
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed variant caller for genomics
tools.detailed_description: A distributed variant caller built on top of the ADAM genomics processing engine, designed for calling variants from high-throughput sequencing data.

tools.name: Icarus
tools.one_line_profile: Stellar binary light curve synthesis tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for synthesizing light curves of stellar binary systems, used for modeling and analyzing binary star data.

tools.name: Astro R-CNN
tools.one_line_profile: Instance segmentation for astronomical images using Mask R-CNN
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Mask R-CNN adapted for instance segmentation and detection of sources in astronomical images.

tools.name: taufit
tools.one_line_profile: AGN light curve modeling and parameter estimation
tools.detailed_description: A tool for efficient modeling of Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN) light curves and parameter estimation using the celerite library.

tools.name: Deep-LC
tools.one_line_profile: General astrophysical light curve classification package
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for the classification of general astrophysical light curves using deep learning techniques.

tools.name: astrodash
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for automated spectral classification of supernovae
tools.detailed_description: DASH (Deep Automated Supernova cHaracterization) is a deep learning software for the automated spectral classification of supernovae.

tools.name: SCONES
tools.one_line_profile: Self-Consistent Neural Network for Protein Stability Prediction
tools.detailed_description: A neural network based tool for predicting protein stability changes upon mutations, utilizing a self-consistent representation of the protein environment.

tools.name: AVOCADO
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive Optimal Collision Avoidance driven by Opinion
tools.detailed_description: A robotics navigation framework implementing an adaptive optimal collision avoidance algorithm driven by opinion dynamics, as presented in IEEE Transactions on Robotics.

tools.name: braai
tools.one_line_profile: Real-bogus astrophysical event classification for ZTF
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning based tool for separating real astrophysical events from bogus detections (artifacts) in Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF) data.

tools.name: tails
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning based comet detection for ZTF
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning pipeline designed to identify and chase comets within the Zwicky Transient Facility (ZTF) data stream.

tools.name: lightcurver
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for light curve extraction from astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed for the precise extraction of light curves through forward modelling of regions from time-series wide-field astronomical images.

tools.name: upsilon
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Classification of Periodic Variable Stars
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning library for the automated classification of periodic variable stars using light curve features.

tools.name: AltaiPony
tools.one_line_profile: Flare finding in Kepler and TESS light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for de-trending light curves and finding stellar flares in Kepler, K2, and TESS mission data.

tools.name: jaxoplanet
tools.one_line_profile: Astronomical time series analysis with JAX
tools.detailed_description: A library for probabilistic inference and analysis of astronomical time series (specifically exoplanets) built on top of JAX.

tools.name: kantime
tools.one_line_profile: R bindings for NeuralForecast KAN models
tools.detailed_description: Provides R bindings for Nixtla's neuralforecast library, specifically enabling the use of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs) for time series forecasting within the R ecosystem.

tools.name: cosmogrb
tools.one_line_profile: Cosmological GRB light curve simulator
tools.detailed_description: A simulator for generating synthetic light curves of Gamma-Ray Bursts (GRBs) in a cosmological context, useful for testing analysis pipelines.

tools.name: lightcurve_fitting
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to fit analytical models to multiband light curves
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for fitting analytical models to multiband light curves of astronomical transients, supporting parameter estimation.

tools.name: grtrace
tools.one_line_profile: General Relativity Raytracer
tools.detailed_description: A raytracing tool that simulates light bending in curved spacetimes, allowing for visualization and analysis of general relativity effects.

tools.name: magic-microlensing
tools.one_line_profile: Microlensing Analysis Guided by Intelligent Computation
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based framework for the automatic analysis and modeling of realistic microlensing light curves using neural networks.

tools.name: astroNN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning for Astronomers with Keras
tools.detailed_description: A python package containing deep learning tools and models specifically designed for astronomical applications, including spectroscopy and photometry analysis.

tools.name: PyTransit
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and easy exoplanet transit light curve modelling
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for creating exoplanet transit light curves, offering optimized performance for modelling and analysis of photometric data.

tools.name: Fulu
tools.one_line_profile: Supernova light curve approximation library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing machine learning-based methods for approximating and augmenting supernova light curves, useful for handling sparse astronomical time-series data.

tools.name: Avocado (Epigenomics)
tools.one_line_profile: Deep tensor factorization for epigenome imputation
tools.detailed_description: A multi-scale deep tensor factorization model that learns latent representations of the human epigenome to impute missing experiments and analyze epigenomic data.

tools.name: VARTOOLS
tools.one_line_profile: Command line tool for astronomical time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: A program for processing and analyzing astronomical time series data, providing tools for period search, light curve manipulation, and statistics.

tools.name: FATS-2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Feature Analysis for Time Series in Astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for extracting features from astronomical light curves to facilitate machine learning classification and variability analysis.

tools.name: xSAGA
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning extension for SAGA galaxy survey
tools.detailed_description: A tool extending the SAGA survey to wide-field regimes using deep learning to identify satellite galaxies around Milky Way analogs.

tools.name: Avocado (Astronomy)
tools.one_line_profile: Photometric classification of astronomical transients
tools.detailed_description: A package for the photometric classification of astronomical transients and variables, featuring data augmentation techniques (Gaussian Process) to handle biased spectroscopic samples.

tools.name: Pyriod
tools.one_line_profile: Period detection and fitting for astronomical time series
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for identifying periods in astronomical time series data and fitting models to the variability.

tools.name: light-curve
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance time-series feature extraction in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library for fast and efficient feature extraction from time-series data, specifically designed for astronomical light curves.

tools.name: light-curve-python
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for light-curve feature extraction
tools.detailed_description: Python bindings for the 'light-curve' Rust library, enabling fast feature extraction from astronomical light curves within Python workflows.

tools.name: batman
tools.one_line_profile: Fast transit light curve models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the calculation of exoplanet transit light curves, known for its speed and flexibility in modelling transit events.

tools.name: LLCaps
tools.one_line_profile: Low-light enhancement for capsule endoscopy
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model for illuminating low-light capsule endoscopy images using curved wavelet attention and reverse diffusion.

tools.name: lightcurves
tools.one_line_profile: R code for light curve analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of R scripts and functions for analyzing light curves, including classification, noisification, and outlier detection.

tools.name: LightCurvesClassifier
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning classifier for astronomical light curves
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for the machine learning-based classification of astronomical objects using their light curve data.

tools.name: ELISa
tools.one_line_profile: Eclipsing binary Learning and Interactive System
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for efficient modeling of light and radial velocity curves of eclipsing binaries, including optimization methods like MCMC.

tools.name: MiraPy
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning library for Astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A Python package facilitating the application of deep learning techniques to astronomical data, including light curves and images.

tools.name: AnomalyALeRCE
tools.one_line_profile: Anomaly Detector for ALeRCE broker
tools.detailed_description: A tool for detecting anomalies in astronomical data streams processed by the ALeRCE broker.

tools.name: BTSbot
tools.one_line_profile: Automated supernova identification bot
tools.detailed_description: A multi-modal deep learning system for the automated identification and classification of supernovae from survey data.

tools.name: ExoMiner
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for exoplanet validation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for automating the vetting and validation of exoplanet candidates from Kepler and TESS photometry missions.

tools.name: ellc
tools.one_line_profile: Light curve model for transiting exoplanets and eclipsing binary stars
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran/Python tool for modeling light curves of transiting exoplanets and eclipsing binary stars, capable of handling various stellar shapes and limb darkening profiles.

tools.name: pycheops
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tool for light curves from the ESA Cheops mission
tools.detailed_description: A Python module specifically designed for the analysis of light curve data from the ESA Cheops mission, including detrending and transit fitting capabilities.

tools.name: deepCR
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Learning based cosmic ray removal for astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool for identifying and removing cosmic rays from astronomical images, offering rapid processing compared to traditional methods.

tools.name: everest
tools.one_line_profile: De-trending pipeline for K2 light curves
tools.detailed_description: EPIC Variability Extraction and Removal for Exoplanet Science Targets (EVEREST) is a pipeline for de-trending K2 light curves to reveal exoplanet transits.

tools.name: planetplanet
tools.one_line_profile: General photodynamical code for exoplanet light curves
tools.detailed_description: A general photodynamical code designed to model exoplanet light curves, handling planet-planet interactions and other dynamical effects.

tools.name: lcviz
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive light curve visualization tool for Jdaviz
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool built on the Jdaviz framework, designed specifically for viewing and analyzing astronomical light curves, supported by STScI.

tools.name: SuperNNova
tools.one_line_profile: Photometric classification of supernovae using Deep Learning
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework for photometric classification of supernovae using deep learning techniques (RNNs, Bayesian NNs, CNNs), designed for large-scale surveys.

tools.name: SCONE Core
tools.one_line_profile: Open source software for predictive simulation of biological motion
tools.detailed_description: SCONE is a software framework for performing predictive simulations of human and animal motion. It is designed to optimize neuromuscular controllers for musculoskeletal models.

tools.name: SCONE Studio
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical User Interface for the SCONE simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: SCONE Studio provides a GUI for setting up, running, and analyzing predictive simulations of biological motion using the SCONE core library.

tools.name: Sconegym
tools.one_line_profile: OpenAI Gym environments for SCONE biomechanics simulations
tools.detailed_description: Provides Reinforcement Learning environments for musculoskeletal simulations, bridging the SCONE simulator with standard RL algorithms.

tools.name: Time-Series-Library
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for advanced deep time series analysis models
tools.detailed_description: A state-of-the-art library containing implementations of various deep learning models (Transformers, MLP, CNNs) for time series forecasting, classification, anomaly detection, and imputation.

tools.name: baguette
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip model wrappers for bagging ensembles
tools.detailed_description: Part of the tidymodels ecosystem, providing efficient implementations for bagging (bootstrap aggregating) models, including trees and MARS.

tools.name: bonsai
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for advanced tree-based models
tools.detailed_description: An extension to the parsnip package in R, providing bindings for LightGBM and Partykit tree models for statistical learning.

tools.name: censored
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip engines for survival analysis models
tools.detailed_description: Provides a unified interface for survival analysis models within the tidymodels framework, enabling time-to-event prediction.

tools.name: discrim
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for discriminant analysis models
tools.detailed_description: Enables discriminant analysis and Naive Bayes models within the tidymodels ecosystem for classification tasks.

tools.name: multilevelmod
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip bindings for multilevel and hierarchical models
tools.detailed_description: Provides an interface for fitting mixed-effects and hierarchical models (e.g., lme4, nlme) using the parsnip syntax.

tools.name: parsnip
tools.one_line_profile: Unified interface for modeling in R
tools.detailed_description: The core modeling package of the tidymodels ecosystem, providing a consistent interface to train and predict with a wide variety of statistical and machine learning models.

tools.name: poissonreg
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip wrappers for Poisson regression models
tools.detailed_description: Extensions for parsnip to handle Poisson regression and other count data models.

tools.name: rules
tools.one_line_profile: Parsnip bindings for rule-based models
tools.detailed_description: Provides infrastructure for rule-based classification and regression models (like C5.0 and Cubist) within tidymodels.

tools.name: pylightcurve
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for modeling and analyzing transit light-curves
tools.detailed_description: A tool for modeling exoplanet transits and analyzing their light curves, including limb darkening and orbit calculation.

tools.name: VBBinaryLensing
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for microlensing light curve calculation
tools.detailed_description: A code for computing magnification of gravitational microlensing events caused by binary lens systems, using the VBB (Valerio Bozza Binary) method.

tools.name: fastdup
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for insights, quality control, and deduplication of image/video datasets
tools.detailed_description: A scalable tool for analyzing large visual datasets to identify duplicates, anomalies, and quality issues, essential for curating scientific image datasets (e.g., in astronomy or biology).

tools.name: astrobase
tools.one_line_profile: Python modules for light curve work and variable star astronomy
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python modules for analyzing light curves, performing period finding, and other tasks related to variable star astronomy.

tools.name: Astronet-Triage
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Network for TESS Light Curve Triage
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model and tool designed to triage light curves from the TESS mission, identifying potential transit candidates.
